TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ImageReader extends Java.Lang.Object

remarks.para: The ImageReader class allows direct application access to image data rendered into a

Several Android media API classes accept Surface objects as targets to render to, including , , , and . The image sizes and formats that can be used with each source vary, and should be checked in the documentation for the specific API.

The image data is encapsulated in objects, and multiple such objects can be accessed at the same time, up to the number specified by the maxImages constructor parameter. New images sent to an ImageReader through its are queued until accessed through the or call. Due to memory limits, an image source will eventually stall or drop Images in trying to render to the Surface if the ImageReader does not obtain and release Images at a rate equal to the production rate.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Media.Image AcquireLatestImage() cil managed

Docs.summary: Acquire the latest from the ImageReader's queue, dropping older .

remarks.para: Acquire the latest from the ImageReader's queue, dropping older . Returns null if no new image is available.

This operation will acquire all the images possible from the ImageReader, but all images that aren't the latest. This function is recommended to use over for most use-cases, as it's more suited for real-time processing.

Note that should be at least 2 for to be any different than - discarding all-but-the-newest requires temporarily acquiring two at once. Or more generally, calling with less than two images of margin, that is (maxImages - currentAcquiredImages will not discard as expected.

This operation will fail by throwing an if maxImages have been acquired with or . In particular a sequence of calls greater than without calling in-between will exhaust the underlying queue. At such a time, will be thrown until more images are released with .

Docs.exception: if too many images are currently acquired

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Media.Image AcquireNextImage() cil managed

Docs.summary: Acquire the next Image from the ImageReader's queue.

remarks.para: Acquire the next Image from the ImageReader's queue. Returns null if no new image is available.

Warning: Consider using instead, as it will automatically release older images, and allow slower-running processing routines to catch up to the newest frame. Usage of is recommended for batch/background processing. Incorrectly using this function can cause images to appear with an ever-increasing delay, followed by a complete stall where no new images seem to appear.

This operation will fail by throwing an if maxImages have been acquired with or . In particular a sequence of or calls greater than without calling in-between will exhaust the underlying queue. At such a time, will be thrown until more images are released with .

Docs.exception: if maxImages images are currently acquired

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() cil managed

Docs.summary: Free up all the resources associated with this ImageReader.

remarks.para: Free up all the resources associated with this ImageReader.

After calling this method, this ImageReader can not be used. Calling any methods on this ImageReader and Images previously provided by or will result in an , and attempting to read from returned by an earlier call will have undefined behavior.

Docs.summary: The default height of , in pixels.

remarks.para: The default height of , in pixels.
The height may be overridden by the producer sending buffers to this ImageReader's Surface. If so, the actual height of the images can be found using .
The default of .

Some color formats may be overridden by the producer sending buffers to this ImageReader's Surface if the default color format allows. ImageReader guarantees that all acquired from ImageReader (for example, with ) will have a "compatible" format to what was specified in . As of now, each format is only compatible to itself. The actual format of the images can be found using .

Docs.summary: Maximum number of images that can be acquired from the ImageReader by any time (for example, with ).

remarks.para: Maximum number of images that can be acquired from the ImageReader by any time (for example, with ).
An image is considered acquired after it's returned by a function from ImageReader, and until the Image is to release the image back to the ImageReader.

Attempting to acquire more than maxImages concurrently will result in the acquire function throwing a . Furthermore, while the max number of images have been acquired by the ImageReader user, the producer enqueueing additional images may stall until at least one image has been released.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Media.ImageReader NewInstance (int width, int height, Android.Graphics.ImageFormatType format, int maxImages);
.method public static hidebysig class Android.Media.ImageReader NewInstance(int32 width, int32 height, valuetype Android.Graphics.ImageFormatType format, int32 maxImages) cil managed

Docs.param: The default width in pixels of the Images that this reader will produce.
The default height in pixels of the Images that this reader will produce.
The format of the Image that this reader will produce. This must be one of the or constants. Note that not all formats is supported, like ImageFormat.NV21.

The maximum number of images the user will want to access simultaneously. This should be as small as possible to limit memory use. Once maxImages Images are obtained by the user, one of them has to be released before a new Image will become available for access through or . Must be greater than 0.

remarks.para: Create a new reader for images of the desired size and format.

The maxImages parameter determines the maximum number of objects that can be be acquired from the ImageReader simultaneously. Requesting more buffers will use up more memory, so it is important to use only the minimum number necessary for the use case.
The valid sizes and formats depend on the source of the image data.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetOnImageAvailableListener (Android.Media.ImageReader.IOnImageAvailableListener listener, Android.OS.Handler handler);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetOnImageAvailableListener(class Android.Media.ImageReader/IOnImageAvailableListener listener, class Android.OS.Handler handler) cil managed

Docs.param: The listener that will be run.
The handler on which the listener should be invoked, or null if the listener should be invoked on the calling thread's looper.
Docs.summary: Register a listener to be invoked when a new image becomes available from the ImageReader.

remarks.para: Register a listener to be invoked when a new image becomes available from the ImageReader.

Docs.exception: If no handler specified and the calling thread has no looper.

remarks.para: Get a that can be used to produce for this ImageReader.

Until valid image data is rendered into this , the method will return null. Only one source can be producing data into this Surface at the same time, although the same can be reused with a different API once the first source is disconnected from the .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: The default width of , in pixels.

remarks.para: The default width of , in pixels.
The width may be overridden by the producer sending buffers to this ImageReader's Surface. If so, the actual width of the images can be found using .
